wps:Process.ows:Title: Area
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the area of a geometry, in the units of the geometry. Assumes a Cartesian plane, so this process is only recommended for non-geographic CRSes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Boundary
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry boundary. For polygons, returns a linear ring or multi-linestring equal to the boundary of the polygon(s). For linestrings, returns a multipoint equal to the endpoints of the linestring. For points, returns an empty geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Buffer
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a polygonal geometry representing the input geometry enlarged by a given distance around its exterior.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Centroid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the geometric centroid of a geometry. Output is a single point. The centroid point may be located outside the geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Contains Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if no points of the second geometry lie in the exterior of the first geometry and at least one point of the interior of second geometry lies in the interior of first geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Convex Hull
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the smallest convex polygon that contains the entire input geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Crosses Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries have some, but not all, interior points in common.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Densify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a spatially equivalent geometry with vertices added to ensure line segments are no longer than a given distance.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Difference
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points that are contained in a geometry but not contained in a second geometry. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dimension
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the largest dimension of a geometry or geometry collection: 0 for point, 1 for line, 2 for polygon.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Disjoint Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries do not have any points in common.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Distance
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the minimum distance between two geometries. Measurement is given in the input units, so geographic coordinates are not recommended.

wps:Process.ows:Title: End Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the final vertex of a LineString.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Envelope
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the smallest bounding box polygon that contains a geometry. For a point geometry, returns the same point.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exactly Equal Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries are identical on a vertex-by-vertex basis.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exactly Equal Test with Tolerance
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries are identical on a vertex-by-vertex basis, up to a vertex distance tolerance.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exterior Ring
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the exterior ring of a polygonal geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geometry Type
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the name of a geometry's type. Values are one of POINT, LINESTRING, POLYGON, MULTIPOINT, MULTILINESTRING, MULTIPOLYGON, GEOMETRYCOLLECTION.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the geometry element at a given index in a geometry collection. Indexing starts at 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Get X Ordinate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the X value (first ordinate) for point geometries. For other geometry types returns the X value of the centroid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Get Y Ordinate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the Y value (second ordinate) for point geometries. For other geometry types returns the Y value of the centroid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Interior Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point that lies inside a geometry if possible, or that lies on its boundary.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Interior Ring
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a linear ring from a polygon containing interior rings (holes) determined by a given index. First interior ring has index 0. If no interior rings, returns null.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersection
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points that two geometries have in common. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection. If no intersection, returns an empty geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersects Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries intersect.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Closed Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the initial vertex equals the final vertex in a linear geometry. Points and polygons always return True.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Empty Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry contains no vertices.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ring Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is both closed and simple.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simple Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is topologically simple. Points, polygons, closed line strings, and linear rings are always simple. Other geometries are considered simple if no two points are identical.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Valid Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is topologically valid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Within Distance Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the minimum distance between two geometries is less than a tolerance value.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Length
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total length of all line segments in a geometry. Measurement is given in the source units, so geographic coordinates are not recommended.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geometry Count
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total number of elements in a geometry collection. If not a geometry collection, returns 1. If empty, returns 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Interior Ring Count
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total number of interior rings in a polygonal geometry. Points and lines return 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of Points
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the number of vertices in a given geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Overlaps Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries share some but not all interior points. Points or lines will always return False.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the Nth vertex in a geometry as determined by a given index. First vertex has index 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Polygonize
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Creates a set of polygons from linestrings delineating them. The linestrings must be correctly noded (i.e. touch only at endpoints).

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relate Matrix String
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the DE-9IM intersection matrix string for the spatial relationship between the input geometries. The matrix string is in the form [II][IB][IE][BI][BB][BE][EI][EB][EE] where I=interior, B=boundary, and E=exterior. Matrix symbols are 2, 1, 0 or F.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relate Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the spatial relationship between two geometries matches the given DE-9IM intersection matrix pattern. The pattern is given in the form [II][IB][IE][BI][BB][BE][EI][EB][EE] where I=interior, B=boundary, and E=exterior. Pattern symbols can be 2, 1, 0, F or *.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reproject Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reprojects a given geometry into a supplied coordinate reference system.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simplify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry that has been simplified (reduced in vertices) according to the Douglas-Peucker algorithm.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Split Polygon
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Splits a polygon by a linestring

wps:Process.ows:Title: Start Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the first vertex of a LineString.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Symmetric Difference
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points contained in either one of two geometries but not in both. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Touches Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries have at least one boundary point in common, but share no interior points.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Union
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing all points contained in any of the geometries in a geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Within Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the first geometry is contained in the second geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Area
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the area of a geometry, in the units of the geometry. Assumes a Cartesian plane, so this process is only recommended for non-geographic CRSes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Boundary
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry boundary. For polygons, returns a linear ring or multi-linestring equal to the boundary of the polygon(s). For linestrings, returns a multipoint equal to the endpoints of the linestring. For points, returns an empty geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Buffer
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a polygonal geometry representing the input geometry enlarged by a given distance around its exterior.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Centroid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the geometric centroid of a geometry. Output is a single point. The centroid point may be located outside the geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Contains Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if no points of the second geometry lie in the exterior of the first geometry and at least one point of the interior of second geometry lies in the interior of first geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Convex Hull
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the smallest convex polygon that contains the entire input geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Crosses Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries have some, but not all, interior points in common.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Densify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a spatially equivalent geometry with vertices added to ensure line segments are no longer than a given distance.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Difference
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points that are contained in a geometry but not contained in a second geometry. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dimension
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the largest dimension of a geometry or geometry collection: 0 for point, 1 for line, 2 for polygon.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Disjoint Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries do not have any points in common.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Distance
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the minimum distance between two geometries. Measurement is given in the input units, so geographic coordinates are not recommended.

wps:Process.ows:Title: End Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the final vertex of a LineString.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Envelope
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the smallest bounding box polygon that contains a geometry. For a point geometry, returns the same point.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exactly Equal Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries are identical on a vertex-by-vertex basis.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exactly Equal Test with Tolerance
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries are identical on a vertex-by-vertex basis, up to a vertex distance tolerance.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Exterior Ring
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the exterior ring of a polygonal geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geometry Type
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the name of a geometry's type. Values are one of POINT, LINESTRING, POLYGON, MULTIPOINT, MULTILINESTRING, MULTIPOLYGON, GEOMETRYCOLLECTION.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the geometry element at a given index in a geometry collection. Indexing starts at 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Get X Ordinate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the X value (first ordinate) for point geometries. For other geometry types returns the X value of the centroid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Get Y Ordinate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the Y value (second ordinate) for point geometries. For other geometry types returns the Y value of the centroid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Interior Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point that lies inside a geometry if possible, or that lies on its boundary.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Interior Ring
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a linear ring from a polygon containing interior rings (holes) determined by a given index. First interior ring has index 0. If no interior rings, returns null.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersection
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points that two geometries have in common. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection. If no intersection, returns an empty geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersects Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries intersect.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Closed Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the initial vertex equals the final vertex in a linear geometry. Points and polygons always return True.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Empty Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry contains no vertices.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ring Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is both closed and simple.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simple Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is topologically simple. Points, polygons, closed line strings, and linear rings are always simple. Other geometries are considered simple if no two points are identical.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Valid Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if a geometry is topologically valid.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Within Distance Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the minimum distance between two geometries is less than a tolerance value.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Length
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total length of all line segments in a geometry. Measurement is given in the source units, so geographic coordinates are not recommended.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geometry Count
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total number of elements in a geometry collection. If not a geometry collection, returns 1. If empty, returns 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Interior Ring Count
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the total number of interior rings in a polygonal geometry. Points and lines return 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of Points
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the number of vertices in a given geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Overlaps Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries share some but not all interior points. Points or lines will always return False.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nth Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the Nth vertex in a geometry as determined by a given index. First vertex has index 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Polygonize
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Creates a set of polygons from linestrings delineating them. The linestrings must be correctly noded (i.e. touch only at endpoints).

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relate Matrix String
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the DE-9IM intersection matrix string for the spatial relationship between the input geometries. The matrix string is in the form [II][IB][IE][BI][BB][BE][EI][EB][EE] where I=interior, B=boundary, and E=exterior. Matrix symbols are 2, 1, 0 or F.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relate Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the spatial relationship between two geometries matches the given DE-9IM intersection matrix pattern. The pattern is given in the form [II][IB][IE][BI][BB][BE][EI][EB][EE] where I=interior, B=boundary, and E=exterior. Pattern symbols can be 2, 1, 0, F or *.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reproject Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reprojects a given geometry into a supplied coordinate reference system.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simplify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry that has been simplified (reduced in vertices) according to the Douglas-Peucker algorithm.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Split Polygon
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Splits a polygon by a linestring

wps:Process.ows:Title: Start Point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a point geometry equal to the first vertex of a LineString.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Symmetric Difference
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing the points contained in either one of two geometries but not in both. The result may be a heterogeneous geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Touches Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if two geometries have at least one boundary point in common, but share no interior points.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Union
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a geometry representing all points contained in any of the geometries in a geometry collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Within Test
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Tests if the first geometry is contained in the second geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Add Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by pixel-by-pixel addition of two source rasters. Source rasters must have the same bounding box and resolution.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Aggregate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes one or more aggregation functions on a feature attribute. Functions include Count, Average, Max, Median, Min, StdDev, and Sum.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Area Grid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a raster grid of given geographic extent with cell values equal to the area the cell represents on the surface of the earth. Area is computed using the EckertIV projection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: BarnesSurface
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Uses Barnes Analysis to compute an interpolated surface over a set of irregular data points.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Bounds
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the bounding box of the input features.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Buffer
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Buffers features by a distance value supplied either as a parameter or by a feature attribute. Calculates buffers based on Cartesian distances.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Centroid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the geometric centroids of features

wps:Process.ows:Title: Clip
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Clips (crops) features to a given geometry

wps:Process.ows:Title: Collect Geometries
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Collects the default geometries of the input features and combines them into a single geometry collection

wps:Process.ows:Title: Contour
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes contour lines at specified intervals or levels for the values in a raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Count Features
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the number of features in a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Crop Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the portion of a raster bounded by a given geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Feature from Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Converts a geometry into a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Georectify Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Georectifies a raster via Ground Control Points using gdal_warp

wps:Process.ows:Title: GetFullCoverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster from the catalog, with optional filtering

wps:Process.ows:Title: Grid
Heatmap
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a heatmap surface over a set of data points and outputs as a single-band raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Import to Catalog
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Imports a feature collection into the catalog

wps:Process.ows:Title: Inclusion of Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a feature collection consisting of the features from the first collection which are spatially contained in at least one feature of the second collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersection of Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Spatial intersection of two feature collections, including combining attributes from both.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geocode point in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts points at a given measure from LRS features

wps:Process.ows:Title: Measure point in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the measure of a point along a feature (as feature with attribute lrs_measure). The point is measured along the nearest feature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extract Segment in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts segment between a given start and end measure from LRS features

wps:Process.ows:Title: Multiply Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by pixel-by-pixel multiplication of two source rasters. Source rasters must have the same bounding box and resolution.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nearest Feature
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the feature in a given feature collection that has the smallest distance to a given point.

wps:Process.ows:Title: PagedUnique
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Gets the list of unique values for the given featurecollection on a specified field, allows optional paging

wps:Process.ows:Title: Point Buffers
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a collection of circular buffer polygons with specified radii centered on a given point

wps:Process.ows:Title: Point Stacker
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Aggregates a collection of points over a grid into one point per grid cell.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Polygon Extraction
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts vector polygons from a raster, based on regions which are equal or in given ranges

wps:Process.ows:Title: Query
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Queries a feature collection using an optional filter and an optional list of attributes to include. Can also be used to convert feature collection format.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reclassify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reclassifies a continous raster into integer values defined by a set of ranges

wps:Process.ows:Title: Raster As Point Collection
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a collection of point features for the pixels of a raster. The band values are provided as attributes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Raster Zonal Statistics
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes statistics for the distribution of a certain quantity in a set of polygonal zones.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rectangular Clip
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Clips (crops) features to the specified rectangular extent

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reproject Features
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reprojects features into a supplied coordinate reference system. Can also force a feature collection to have a given CRS.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reproject Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reprojects a given geometry into a supplied coordinate reference system.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Scale Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a scaled and translated version of a given raster

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simplify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Simplifies feature geometry by reducing vertices using Douglas-Peucker simplification.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snap
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the feature in a feature collection nearest to a given point. Attributes for distance and bearing are added.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Store Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Stores a raster on the server.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Style Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Styles a raster using a given SLD and raster symbolizer.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Transform
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a new feature collection from the input one by renaming, deleting, and computing new attributes. Attribute values are specified as ECQL expressions in the form name=expression.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Union Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns single feature collection containing all features from two input feature collections. The output attribute schema is a combination of the attributes from the inputs. Attributes with same name but different types will be converted to strings.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Unique
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the unique values of a given attribute in a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Vector Zonal Statistics
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes statistics for the distribution of a given attribute in a set of polygonal zones. Input must be points.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Transform
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Converts some or all of a feature collection to a raster grid, using an attribute to specify cell values.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Polygon label process
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the Pole of accessibility, the most distant interior point in a polygon.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Add Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by pixel-by-pixel addition of two source rasters. Source rasters must have the same bounding box and resolution.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Transformed Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the result of an Affine transformation on the input raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Area Grid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a raster grid of given geographic extent with cell values equal to the area the cell represents on the surface of the earth. Area is computed using the EckertIV projection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Merge Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by the merge of the input raster bands. Source rasters must have the same CRS.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Select Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by the selection of some bands from the input raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Contour
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes contour lines at specified intervals or levels for the values in a raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: coverageClassStats
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculates statistics from coverage values classified into bins/classes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Crop Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the portion of a raster bounded by a given geometry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Jiffle map algebra
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Map algebra powered by Jiffle

wps:Process.ows:Title: Multiply Coverages
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a raster generated by pixel-by-pixel multiplication of two source rasters. Source rasters must have the same bounding box and resolution.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Normalize Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Normalizes a coverage by dividing values by the max value

wps:Process.ows:Title: Polygon Extraction
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts vector polygons from a raster, based on regions which are equal or in given ranges

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reclassify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reclassifies a continous raster into integer values defined by a set of ranges

wps:Process.ows:Title: Raster As Point Collection
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a collection of point features for the pixels of a raster. The band values are provided as attributes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Raster Zonal Statistics
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes statistics for the distribution of a certain quantity in a set of polygonal zones.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Scale Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a scaled and translated version of a given raster

wps:Process.ows:Title: Style Coverage
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Styles a raster using a given SLD and raster symbolizer.

wps:Process.ows:Title: TransparencyFill
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Fill transparent pixels

wps:Process.ows:Title: Aggregate
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes one or more aggregation functions on a feature attribute. Functions include Count, Average, Max, Median, Min, StdDev, and Sum.

wps:Process.ows:Title: BarnesSurface
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Uses Barnes Analysis to compute an interpolated surface over a set of irregular data points.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Bounds
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the bounding box of the input features.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Buffer
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Buffers features by a distance value supplied either as a parameter or by a feature attribute. Calculates buffers based on Cartesian distances.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Centroid
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the geometric centroids of features

wps:Process.ows:Title: ClassifyByRange
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a new attribute to classify another attribute by intervals over vector data sets.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Clip
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Clips (crops) features to a given geometry

wps:Process.ows:Title: Collect Geometries
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Collects the default geometries of the input features and combines them into a single geometry collection

wps:Process.ows:Title: Count Features
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the number of features in a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Feature from Geometry
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Converts a geometry into a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: featureClassStats
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculates statistics from feature values classified into bins/classes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Grid
Heatmap
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a heatmap surface over a set of data points and outputs as a single-band raster.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Inclusion of Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a feature collection consisting of the features from the first collection which are spatially contained in at least one feature of the second collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Intersection of Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Spatial intersection of two feature collections, including combining attributes from both.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Geocode point in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts points at a given measure from LRS features

wps:Process.ows:Title: Measure point in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the measure of a point along a feature (as feature with attribute lrs_measure). The point is measured along the nearest feature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extract Segment in LRS
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Extracts segment between a given start and end measure from LRS features

wps:Process.ows:Title: Nearest Feature
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the feature in a given feature collection that has the smallest distance to a given point.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Point Buffers
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns a collection of circular buffer polygons with specified radii centered on a given point

wps:Process.ows:Title: Point Stacker
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Aggregates a collection of points over a grid into one point per grid cell.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Query
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Queries a feature collection using an optional filter and an optional list of attributes to include. Can also be used to convert feature collection format.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rectangular Clip
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Clips (crops) features to the specified rectangular extent

wps:Process.ows:Title: Reproject Features
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Reprojects features into a supplied coordinate reference system. Can also force a feature collection to have a given CRS.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Simplify
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Simplifies feature geometry by reducing vertices using Douglas-Peucker simplification.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snap
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the feature in a feature collection nearest to a given point. Attributes for distance and bearing are added.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Transform
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes a new feature collection from the input one by renaming, deleting, and computing new attributes. Attribute values are specified as ECQL expressions in the form name=expression.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Union Feature Collections
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns single feature collection containing all features from two input feature collections. The output attribute schema is a combination of the attributes from the inputs. Attributes with same name but different types will be converted to strings.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Unique
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the unique values of a given attribute in a feature collection.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Transform
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Converts some or all of a feature collection to a raster grid, using an attribute to specify cell values.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Vector Zonal Statistics
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes statistics for the distribution of a given attribute in a set of polygonal zones. Input must be points.
